semantic_identifier: 82: feat: Setup wizard: default sales stage template + guided CRM stage mapping with validation

sections.text:
## Description

This PR adds a new setup-wizard step that proposes a default canonical Sales_Accelerator stage model and guides users through mapping their CRM pipeline stages into it.

Key changes:
- Introduces a canonical default stage template (Prospecting → Qualification → Proposal → Negotiation → Closed Won/Lost) used as a starting point during setup.
- Detects the active CRM pipeline configuration and pre-populates suggested mappings using name/semantic matching (e.g., “Commit”, “Closed Won”, “Closed Lost”, “Negotiation”).
- Adds an interactive mapping/merge flow that lets users:
  - map each active CRM stage to a canonical stage,
  - merge multiple CRM stages into a single canonical stage when appropriate,
  - mark closed outcomes explicitly (Won vs Lost).
- Implements validation rules:
  - every active CRM stage must be mapped before continuing,
  - key milestones must be covered (at minimum: a “commit/late-stage” equivalent and both closed outcomes).
- Persists the mapping as the org’s stage configuration used by stage-based forecasting, next-best-action, and risk alerts.

Implementation notes (high-level):
- Backend:
  - Adds stage-template and mapping suggestion logic (pipeline stage ingestion → normalized labels → suggested canonical mapping).
  - Adds endpoints to fetch detected pipeline stages + suggestions and to save validated mappings.
  - Adds server-side validation to prevent incomplete/invalid mappings from being saved.
- Frontend:
  - Adds a setup step UI to display canonical stages and allow mapping/merging CRM stages via selection controls.
  - Adds inline validation/error states and blocks progression until requirements are met.

User impact:
- During initial setup, users will now see a suggested stage model and mapping step, reducing manual configuration and improving consistency of downstream stage-based features.
